#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=3. Results
#Text=3.1. CD63 Immunohistochemistry of Ductuli Efferentes in Chinese Soft-Shelled Turtle
#Text=Light microscopic observation of DE in Chinese soft-shelled turtle (
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=shows sections through DE ) , and sperm were exhibited in the DE lumens (
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=A ) .
#Text=The detailed observation indicates that DE had distinct populations of ciliated cells ( CC ) and non-ciliated cells ( NCC ) .
#Text=The nuclei of CC and NCC are located apically and basally , respectively .
#Text=Numbers of cilias originating from the CC into the lumen of DE , forming a network that had spermatozoa (
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=B , C ) .
#Text=The CD63 immunohistochemistry results indicated moderate to strong immunosignals , mainly observed within the apical cytoplasm of CC .
#Text=More precisely , the strong CD63 immunopositivity was observed within the apical region where cilia protrude out to the lumen of the DE .
#Text=Between CC and NCC , the CD63 immunolabeling was moderate to strong .
#Text=Whereas , the cytoplasm of NCC showed weak to moderate localization of CD63 (
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=D , E ) .
#Text=3.2. Ultrastructure of Ductuli Efferentes and Distribution of Early Endosomes and Multivesicular Bodies
#Text=The morphology of DE consists of the CC and NCC as described earlier by our research group .
#Text=The nuclei of CC were ovoid , and mitochondria were predominantly observed in the perinuclear cytoplasm .
#Text=Coated pits and junctional complexes were frequently observed at apical borders of CC and vesicles were evenly distributed throughout the cytoplasm in the CC and NCC .
#Text=The nuclei of NCC were euchromatic and mitochondria were mainly observed in the perinuclear and supranuclear cytoplasm .
#Text=The lumen of ductuli efferentes showed various microvilli and few cilia .
#Text=(
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=A , B ) .
#Text=Careful observation of the basal region of DE showed that lipid droplets and mitochondria exist near interdigitations and cytoplasmic spaces of CC and NCC .
#Text=Fascinatingly , early endosomes ( EE ) were also clearly observed with heterogeneity of few or more intraluminal vesicles ( ILVs ) (
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=C , D ) .
#Text=In the DE middle region , the EE and multivesicular bodies ( MVBs ) were observed within the peripheral cytoplasm of NCC and near the interdigitations (
#Text=Figure 3
#Text=A – E ) .
#Text=EE , MVBs with varied numbers of ILVs ( Intra-Luminal Vesicles ) , and numerous small vesicles were observed at the basal body of cilia from the CC (
#Text=Figure 3
#Text=F , G ) .
#Text=3.3. Extracellular Vesicles and Their Interaction with Spermatozoa in the Lumen of Ductuli Efferentes
#Text=The lumen of DE showed microvilli , apical blebs , and cilia .
#Text=Microvilli and cilia can easily be distinguished due to their thickness and morphological appearance .
#Text=Apical blebs were observed over the microvilli from the NCC (
#Text=Figure 4
#Text=A ) .
#Text=However , cilia showed blebs containing numerous vesicles that became more numerous with the size of blebs , for that reason , we suggest using the name ciliary blebs (
#Text=Figure 4
#Text=A , B ) .
#Text=Many extracellular vesicles ( EVs ) appeared in the lumen and between the distinct lateral boundary of CC and NCC .
#Text=Collectively , the DE epithelia possessed a well-developed exocytic pathway and showed numerous EVs that might be secreted by the shedding of apical blebs or ciliary blebs .
#Text=Hence , EVs in DE originate in a different way .
#Text=In addition , at the ultrastructural level , these EVs are associated with the principal piece of the spermatozoa (
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=E ) .
